div.head: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE, THOMAS Earle of EXCETER, one of his Maiesties most honorable Priuy Counsell: All grace and happinesse.
div.p:
RIght Honorable, I knew I could not bestow my thoughts better than vpon Gods owne historie, so full of edification and delight: which I haue in such sort indeuoured to doe, that I shall giue occasion to my Reader of some meditations, which perhaps hee would haue missed. Euery
helpe in this kinde deserues to be precious. I present the first part to your Honour, wherein you shall see the world both made, and smoothered againe: Man in the glorie of his creation, and the shame of his fall: Paradise at once made and lost. The first man killing his seede, the second his brother. If in these I shall giue light to the thoughts of any Reader, let him with me giue the praise to him from whom that light shone foorth to me. To whose grace and protection I humbly commend your Lordship: as

closer.signed: Your Honours vnfainedly deuoted in all obseruance and dutie, IOS. HALL.
